I am heading back to Chicago on a business trip at the beginning of February. Hopefully this time the trip will go better than my last whirl-wind tour. I hope to at least have time to visit the Museum of Science and Industry which has come highly recommended.

The original photograph that I used to mock up my wintery walk in Chicago is from Photographs from the Chicago Daily News, 1902-1933, part of the American Memory section of the Library of Congress. In particular I started with Image of Alderman Joseph Badenoch, viewed from the side, walking along a residential street covered in snow in Chicago, Illinois.

This guy was my great grandfather's brother.  I just learned about images of him.

I live in Montana.

How did you come to select this image?

Geoff

">

Back To Chicago

Jan 21, 2003 • Joe Gregorio

I am heading back to Chicago on a business trip at the beginning of February. Hopefully this time the trip will go better than my last whirl-wind tour. I hope to at least have time to visit the Museum of Science and Industry which has come highly recommended.

The original photograph that I used to mock up my wintery walk in Chicago is from Photographs from the Chicago Daily News, 1902-1933, part of the American Memory section of the Library of Congress. In particular I started with Image of Alderman Joseph Badenoch, viewed from the side, walking along a residential street covered in snow in Chicago, Illinois.

This guy was my great grandfather's brother.  I just learned about images of him.

I live in Montana.

How did you come to select this image?

Geoff

Posted by Geoff Badenoch on 2005-05-05

I just picked a random winter shot out of the Chicago Daily News archive.

Posted by Joe on 2005-05-05
